gurmukhi: pRlMbwir Anujnin Awid aucwrIAY ] jwcr kih nwiek pd pun dY fwrIAY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qw ky AMq bKwnIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm cqur pihcwnIAY ]873]
transliteration: Pralandaar(i) Anujananiaadh Oucdareeai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Naaik Pad Poun Daidareeai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taa Ke Ant Bakhaaneeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Chatur Paihchaaneeai||873||
translation: Utter the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” after firstly saying the words “Pralambari-anujanani” and know all the names of Tupak in you mind.873.

gurmukhi: qiRxwvrq Arinn Sbdwid bKwnIAY ] jwcr kih kY puin nwiek pd TwnIAY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qw ky AMq aucwrIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm su mMqR bIcrIAY ]874]
transliteration: Trinaavarat Arnin Shabadaadh Bakhaaneeai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Kai Poun(i) Naaik Pad Thaaneeai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taake Ant Oucdareeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Su Mantra Beecdareeai||874||
translation: Utter firstly the word “Tranaavrat-arnani” and then saying the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru”, know all the names of Tupak.874.

gurmukhi: kysXwNqkinn Awid aucwrn kIjIAY ] jwcr kih kY puin nwiek pd dIjIAY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qwky AMq aucwrIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm su mMqR ibcwrIAY ]875]
transliteration: Kesyaantaknin Aadh Ouchaaran Keejeeai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Kai Poun(i) Naaik Pad Deejeeai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taake Ant Oucdareeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Su Mantra Bicdareeai||875||
translation: Utter the word “Keshiyaantaknin” in the beginning and then speak the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” and in this way consider all the names of Tupak.875.

gurmukhi: bkIAwNqkinn Awid aucwrn kIjIAY ] jwcr kih kY puin nwiek pd dIjIAY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qw ky AMq aucwrIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm subu`D ibcwrIAY ]876]
transliteration: Bakeeaantaknin Aadh Ouchaaran Keejeeai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Kai Poun(i) Naaik Pad Deejeeai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taa Ke Ant Oucdareeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Soubuddh Bicdareeai||876||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Bakiyantaknin” and then uttering the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” and consider wisely all the names of Tupak.876.

gurmukhi: piqnwginn Awid aucwro jwn kY ] jwcr kih kY puin nwiek pd Twn kY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qwky AMq bKwnIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm pRbIn pRmwnIAY ]877]
transliteration: Pat(i)naagnin Aadh Ouchdaro Jaan Kai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Kai Poun(i) Naaik Pad Thaan Kai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taake Ant Bakhaaneeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Prabeen Pramaaneeai||877||
translation: After saying “Patnaganin” (Sheshnaga), utter the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” at the end, and in this way know all the names of Tupak.877.

gurmukhi: sktwsur hnnn Sbdwid BxIjIAY ] jwcr kih pwCy nwiek pd dIjIAY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qwky AMq bKwnIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm suigAwn pCwnIAY ]878]
transliteration: Saktaasur Hananan Shabadaadh Bhaneejeeai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Paachhe Naaik Pad Deejeeai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taake Ant Bakhaaneeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Sougiaan Pachhaadeeai||878||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Shaktasur-hananan” then add the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” and recognize all the names of Tupak.878.

gurmukhi: murArinn Sbdwid Bix`jY ] cwcr kih nwiek pd id`jY ] S`qRu Sbd ko bhur bKwnhu ] sB sRI nwm qupk ky jwnhu ]879]
transliteration: Murarnin Shabadaadh Bhanijjai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Naaik Pad Dijjai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Bahur Bakhaanoh|| Sabh Srinaam Toupak Ke Jaanoh||879||
translation: Mention the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” after firstly uttering the word “Mur-arinin” and know all the names of Tupak.879.

gurmukhi: nrkwNqkinn Awid bKwnhu ] jwcr kih piq Sbd pRmwnhu ] S`qRu Sbd ko bhur Bix`jY ] skl qupk ky nwm kih`jY ]880]
transliteration: Narkaantaknin Aadh Bakhaanoh|| Jaachar Kah(i) Pat(i) Shabad Pramaanoh|| Shattru Shabad Ko Bahur Bhanijjai|| Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Kahijjai||880||
translation: Uttering the word “Narkaantaknin” the beginning and then say ‘jaachar-pati-shatru” and in this way all the names of Tupak are spoken.880.

gurmukhi: Awid nrk hwinn pd BwKo ] jwcr kih nwiek pd rwKo ] S`qRu Sbd ko bhur bKwnhu ] sB sRI nwm qupk ky jwnhu ]881]
transliteration: Aadh Narak Haanin Pad Bhaakho|| Jaachar Kah(i) Naaik Pad Raakho|| Shattru Shabad Ko Bahur Bakhnaaoh|| Sabh Srinaam Toupak Ke Jaanoh||881||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Narak-haanin”, then add the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru” and know the names of Tupak.881.

gurmukhi: S`qRu Gwienin Awid Bix`jY ] jwcr kih nwiek pd id`jY ] S`qRu Sbd ko bhur bKwnhu ] sB sRI nwm qupk pihcwnhu ]882]
transliteration: Shtattra Ghaaenan(i) Aadh Bhanijjai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Naaik Pad Deejjai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Bahur Bakhaanoh|| Sabh Srinaam Toupak Paihchaanoh||882||
translation: Utter firstly the word “Shatru-ghayanin”, then add “Jaachar-nayak” and after wards add the word “Shatru” and in this way know the names of Tupak.882.

gurmukhi: mur mrdinn pd Awid aucwrn kIjIAY ] jwcr kih kY puin nwiek pd dIjIAY ] S`qRu Sbd ko qwky AMq BxIjIAY ] ho skl qupk ky nwm cqur lih lIjIAY ]883]
transliteration: Mur Maradnin Pad Aadh Ouchaaran Keejeeai|| Jaachar Kah(i) Kai Poun(i) Naaik Pad Deejeeai|| Shattru Shabad Ko Taake Ant Bhaneejjeeai|| Ho Sakal Toupak Ke Naam Chatur Lah(i) Leejeeai||883||
translation: Saying fiestly the word “Murmardanin” and then adding the words “Jaachar-nayak-shatru”, know all the names of Tupak.883.
